General.AppDescription: VManager is a powerful and easy-to-use multi-function toolkit that lets you cut, compress, and convert video formats.

WelcomePanel.GuideInfo: For detailed guides and more information about the app, click the

Items1.Item3Description: converts between different video formats (e.g. MKV → MP4).
Items1.Item4Description: turns your videos into audio or converts between audio formats.
Items1.Item5Description: downloads videos from your favorite platforms.

Items2.Item1Description: Select one of the tools in the top-left using the mouse or keyboard shortcut
Items2.Item2Description: Drag the video into the box or select it with the 'Browse' button
Items2.Item3Description: Process the video with the button and you're done!

Footer.Title: Created by Baltazar Franz
Footer.Support: This project is maintained by a single person, so if you'd like to contribute you can click the button below.

Fields.EndBeforeStart: 'To' time must be greater than 'From' time

Tips.FormatSelection: You can use seconds and/or traditional time format (hh:mm:ss).
Tips.ValidInput: As long as the times are valid, use whichever format you prefer.
Tips.NoteDuration: Note: trim duration is automatically recalculated if invalid or empty.

Tips.VideoCodecInfo: The default option is best for most cases.
Tips.VideoCodecHW: Hardware acceleration (GPU) is prioritized when available.
Tips.VideoCodecDefinition: A video codec compresses and decompresses video to save space or stream faster.
Tips.VideoCodecCPU: If you prefer CPU encoding, use codecs like 'libx264'.
Tips.VideoCodecTradeoff: CPU gives the best quality but is significantly slower.
Tips.AudioCodecInfo: The default option works best for most cases.
Tips.AudioCodecDefinition: An audio codec compresses and decompresses sound to save space or stream faster.
Tips.AudioCodecFLAC: FLAC offers exceptional audio quality, but files are much larger.

Tips.FormatSelection: Choose the output format for your video.
Tips.FormatNote: Note: FFmpeg supports many combinations, but some may not be compatible with all devices.
Tips.VideoCodecInfo: The default option is best for most cases.
Tips.VideoCodecDefinition: A video codec compresses/decompresses video to save space or stream faster.
Tips.VideoCodecCPU: For CPU encoding, choose codecs like 'libx264'.
Tips.VideoCodecTradeoff: CPU offers better quality but is much slower.
Tips.AudioCodecInfo: The default works for most cases.
Tips.AudioCodecDefinition: An audio codec compresses/decompresses audio to save space or stream faster.
Tips.AudioCodecFLAC: FLAC offers exceptional quality but takes up much more space.

Tips.FormatNote1: WAV formats are ordered by likelihood of use. Choose the first one if you're unsure.
Tips.FormatNote2: Opus is newer and more efficient; Vorbis is legacy.

Fields.UseCookieFile: Use this cookies file for yt-dlp
Fields.Welcome: Welcome, {0}! What would you like to change? :)

Tips.Hardware1: This button launches multiple FFMpeg instances in parallel to check
Tips.Hardware2: the compatibility of multiple video codecs and then save it in a dropdown list.
Tips.Hardware3: It is not recommended to press this button unless you know what you are doing...
Tips.Hardware4: It can be useful if you change your GPU or encounter a problem, but be aware that it stresses your computer.

CancelDialog.Title: Cancel operation?
CancelDialog.Info: You are about to abruptly terminate the background process.

VCut.Title: VCut — Trim videos
VCut.Description: VCut lets you quickly trim one or more videos using a start and end point.

HowTo.Title: How to use:
HowTo.Step1: 1) Select or drag a video file(s).
HowTo.Step2: 2) Enter the start and end times for the trim.
HowTo.Step4: 4) Wait for background processing to finish.

Notes.Title: Notes:
Notes.A: You can enter time however you like: seconds only, or full hh:mm:ss format.
Notes.B: If the end time exceeds the video length, it will automatically be adjusted to the end of the video.
Notes.C: If no end time is provided, the video will be trimmed to the end.

VCompress.Title: VCompress — Compress & optimize
VCompress.Description: VCompress lets you quickly compress one or more videos, prioritizing your GPU when possible.

HowTo.Title: How to use:
HowTo.Step1: 1) Select or drag one or more video files.

Notes.Title: Notes:
Notes.A: The 'quality percentage' refers to the final file size compared to the original. Often 25 % still gives very acceptable quality with huge size reduction.
Notes.B: Video codecs are ordered by priority. The default will use hardware encoders (Nvidia/AMD/Intel) when available.
Notes.C: When possible, only remuxing is performed (no re-encoding), making the process much faster.

VConvert.Title: VConvert — Format conversion
VConvert.Description: VConvert lets you quickly convert the format of one or more videos.

HowTo.Title: How to use:
HowTo.Step1: 1) Select or drag one or more video files.
HowTo.Step4: 4) Press Enter or click 'Convert Video Format'.

Notes.Title: Notes:
Notes.A: Video codecs are ordered by priority. The default will use hardware encoders specific to your OS/GPU when available.
Notes.B: When possible, only remuxing is performed (no re-encoding), speeding up the process significantly.

VAudiofy.Title: VAudiofy — Extract audio
VAudiofy.Description: VAudiofy lets you quickly convert audio formats or extract audio from one or more videos.

HowTo.Title: How to use:
HowTo.Step1: 1) Select or drag one or more audio/video files.

VDownload.title: VDownload — Download videos
VDownload.description: VDownload allows you to download one or multiple videos from various platforms such as YouTube or TikTok.

howTo.title: How to use:
howTo.step1: 1) Copy the link and paste it into the input field.
howTo.step2: 2) Press the "Add" button to add it to the list.
howTo.step4: 4) Press Enter or click the "Download Video" button.
howTo.step5: 5) Wait while it is processed in the background.

youtube.description: YouTube activates an anti-bot mechanism that requires you to be logged in. In addition, browsers such as Edge and Chrome encrypt cookies.
youtube.solution: It is necessary to use browser cookies from an active session so that VDownload can retrieve the video information. Go to 'Configuration' to set up.

edge.description: If you are using Edge, you need to install the extension

chrome.description: If you are using Chrome, you need to install the extension

windows.otherBrowsers: Most other browsers (except Firefox) are compatible and require Chrome-compatible extensions. You can install the extension

linuxMac.description: No known issues, although using a cookies file is recommended to speed up the process.

limitations.title: Limitations
limitations.item1: Support for multiple video formats has not been implemented yet.
limitations.item2: You may encounter bugs due to the recent implementation of this feature.

WhatIs.Title: What is VManager?
WhatIs.Description: VManager is a set of tools designed to process video quickly, directly, and efficiently. It allows trimming, converting, compressing, and extracting audio without complex settings and with an interface focused on simplicity and productivity.

Privacy.Title: Privacy
Privacy.Description: VManager does not collect, store, or transmit any personal data or user files. All processing happens locally on your device.

Guides.Title: Tool Guides
Guides.Description: Select a guide to learn how to use each module.

Credits.Title: Credits
Credits.Description: Developed by Franz Baltazar. Please note that bugs may appear; I strongly recommend opening an Issue on GitHub.

License.Title: License
License.Description: VManager is free software distributed under the MIT license.
